text:
Hey! I want to show you one of
my favorite hidden gems

in a display here at the Field 
Museum, but before I do that

I want to encourage you, 
if you can, to please 
participate

in the youth climate strikes that are
happening all over the world

this coming 
Friday, September 20th.

I’m going to be supporting 
the Illinois chapter with the
Field Museum here in Chicago.

I actually was invited to give one 
of the talks in federal plaza,

so if you are in the area 
I would love to see you.

And if you are participating, 
please tag me in one of your

photos on social media.
I wanna see your activism, and

I wanna see how you’re
participating.

Unfortunately we don’t have a 
second planet,

but the actions we take right 
now are absolutely critical in

securing a 
more sustainable future.

So your support means literally 
the world to me, and everybody
else who lives on this planet.

Okay, so I’m going to show you 
my favorite gem.

So in our 
evolving planet exhibition,

there is this beautiful diorama 
of a Silurian reef.

This is what Chicago looked 
like 400 Million years ago.

And if you come down here 
and look to the left

of this  green sponge or coral, 
you will find
a tiny model of a cow.

Right there, that an exhibition designer 
put there, for the jokes.

So the next time you visit, 
you can impress your

friends and family with that 
little insider tip.

And I look forward to seeing 
how you participate on Friday.
Thanks!
